frameDefinitions: This frame concerns a Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a Figure within a Ground.

An Influencing_entity, an Influencing_situation, or an Influencing_variable has an influence on a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation,  or a Dependent_variable.  ''  Compare to Subjective_influence.
Some phenomenon (the Stimulus) provokes a particular emotion in an Experiencer.
A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.
Using Evidence, which may or may not be expressed, a Cognizer recognizes or proves that Concept1 is associated causally or collocationally with another concept, Concept2.
An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer.
frameExamples: Legislator tells consumers to be <t>alert</t> to dioxin levels.
More and more doctors realise that diet can <t>influence</t> disease.
Nightmare on Elm Street <t>scared</t> me silly.
The murder of Sergei Kirov <t>set off</t> a chain of events that culminated in the Great Terror of the 1930s.
These works had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is specifically focussing on within the <fen>Ground</fen>.
An entity (or event) associated with a <fen>Perceiver</fen> that gives evidence for a <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s attentiveness.
A thing or person whose behavior has an effect on an <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen> or an <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has  an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation that whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen>, <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>, or <fen>Influencing_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen>, a <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>, or an <fen>Influencing_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics have an effect on a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Influencing_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the influence occurs.
The location at which the influencing occurs.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> reacts emotionally or psychologically to the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the event or entity which brings about the emotional or psychological state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Cause</fen> initiates.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen>  when causing to start occurs
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Effect</fen> occurs.
<fen>Concept1</fen> is the phenomenon which is believed to be related to <fen>Concept2</fen>.
The phenomenon which is believed to be linked to Concept1.
The sentient entity that recognizes the causal connection.
The phenomena which are believed to be related.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> make the connection.
The location where the Cognizer makes the connection.
The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
The <fen>Agent</fen> acts to influence a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.
The location in which one has influence.
listRoleExamples: Much of the acreage in this round is closer to the coastline, and as such has many implications in terms of how <fex>it</fex> could impact upon fish spawning, local bird life, and even the Ministry of Defence in some cases
The Committee is responsible for making recommendations to the Board regarding the group's activities as they impact <fex>on the environment</fex>.
<fex>Factors which</fex> influence the stability of the combination include the softness of the car and the trailer's suspension, plus the balance of the trailer.
The new network file system server line supports database or backup applications running alongside NFS input/output operations without one activity impacting <fex>another</fex>.
This kind of elementary boo-boo would certainly impact <fex>video speed</fex>.
<fex>The news</fex> greatlyalarms all the women of the village.
Few things spark <fex>the wrath of the British</fex> like food additives.
<fex>In Obscurania</fex>, the release of the movie sparked protests.
George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that influenced <fex>Reagan</fex>.
<fex>The balmy temperatures</fex> inspired me to write a poem on the advent of spring.
<fex>The painting</fex> inspired me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.
What factors influenced Nixon <fex>to issue the doctrine</fex>?
Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what influenced him <fex>in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women
Does anyone know what inspired <fex>this song</fex>?
Chavez has much influence <fex>in South America</fex>.
